posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
This dwarven fellow started life as a human Ranger/ Bard/ RDD, but I couldn't really make it work to my satisfaction (yet, at least), so he morphed into a dwarven Fighter/ Bard/ RDD (you can check his birth here: MStar D-Wing ). I've tried to give him a bit of a different spin, while keeping him pretty straightforward. I thought I'd keep at least a vestige of his Ranger heritage by naming him after the dwarven god of wanderers, roads, and explorers.

Anyway, see what you think...

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Let me think...
Start with dex 15 and con 16.
With bard you only need umd 10 to cast from all scrolls, so unless you play in a high magic environment, umd can be lower.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you switch from morningstar to warhammer, you lose the often-resisted piercing damage, but then both of your weapons would have x3 criticals.  Even the word warhammer is similar to the word Marthammor.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
@Mick Dagger: Oh, that's good. Yes, it's -1 to the Reflex save and the (unlikely) naked AC, but it's +1 to the Fortitude save and a further 40 hps, so I can definitely buy that.

I'm less sure about the UMD. Not because of the scroll stuff, but I do like having access to gear I might not otherwise be able to use (random example, top-end Sun Soul boots). I'd guess (and it would be a guess) I could drop sufficient to bump Spellcraft and Listen to their max, and maybe a cc point or two in Search and Disable Trap.

@Empyre65: As ever, you're right - and I do love me some warhammer - but part of my initial thinking was about the under-use of morningstar. And given I've already sacrificed Ranger, I feel I have to draw the line somewhere! Thanks, though.

Cheers, Both!
